title: BBC Local Live: Cumbria for Monday 20 November 2017 - BBC News
summary: poppi worthington inquest will hear from father and 38 other witnesses .
cumbrian radio stations sold to national chain .
dental patients struggle to find care as practice quits nhs .
council appeals to private landlords as homelessness rises .
meet timmy , the tortoise who turns threathening .

documents.title: through the day : bbc cumbria live
text: we 've now finished posting news , travel reports , a regular weather forecast and the occasional other nugget from the county 's social networks .
here 's a reminder :
we 'll be back to do it again tomorrow at 08:00 .
if you 've got a story we should know about , or want to share a photo with the county , you can email them to us , send them using twitter or head to our facebook page
have a very good evening .
author: Martin Lewes
Reporter

documents.title: nhs 'looking for an answer ' to dental problems
text: nhs england , which decides how much work each dental practice can carry out for patients who do n't go private , says it is looking for a way to share out the work of the appleby practice which is ending publicly funded work next month .
one of the neighbouring practices , in sedbergh , says it has turned down a number of patients from appleby , because it would be penalised if it took on extra nhs work .

pauline fletcher , who commissions dental practices in cumbria and the north east for nhs england , said the contracts for the work were very complex , and they were in discussion with local dentists .
we rcognise it 's a difficult situation and we 're working really hard behind the scenes to make sure there 's provision in place when the practice in appleby closes at the end of december . ''

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : mild , with heavier rain
text: it will stay cloudy , but mild , this evening with a few outbreaks of rain .
the rain will become heavier later , and is likely to persist through much of the night with minimum temperatures of 8c ( 46f ) .
you can find the latest bbc weather forecast for where you live , here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: volunteers help plant 17,850 trees on northern fells
text: hundreds of volunteers have so far planted 17,850 trees on a stretch of the northern lake district , according to the national park authority .
the woodlands have been created since 2000 around caldbeck , uldale and dash valley .
lake district national park ranger scott henderson said the planting would create a more diverse environment .
everyone has pulled together to work on schemes which will ultimately see the spread of natural woodlands and increase wildlife in very important areas of the national park . ''

documents.title: police campaign sees 25 firearms handed in
text: police say 25 firearms are among 45 weapons handed into police stations in a fortnight-long campaign .
they included 15 air weapons and six shotguns , but also pistols and a deactivated sub-machine gun .
during the surrender those handing over weapons will not face prosecution for illegal possession and can remain anonymous .
supt mark pannone said : `` every single weapon taken off the street can only be a good thing for our county and the people that live within it . ''

documents.title: defender hill wants to stay at brunton park
text: defender clint hill says he wants to stay at carlisle united beyond the end of his current deal , which runs out in january .
only leaders luton have earned more points in league two than united in the 10 games hill 's played in .
he 's done exactly what was expected of him , he does the simple things very well . ''
author: BBC Cumbria Sport

documents.title: gang rape accused denies 'egging ' boys on
text: gang rape accused denies 'egging ' boys on

documents.title: 'chennai six ' face week 's wait for appeal result
text: six men , including john armstrong from wigton , who were arrested by indian authorities while working as anti-piracy guards in the indian ocean , face a week 's wait to find out whether their appeal against a five-year sentenced has succeeded .
the six were arrested in 2013 and charged with taking weapons into india 's territorial waters .
after a lengthy legal process they were sentenced last year and there 's been a campaign to have them brought back to britain .
their latest appeal finished on monday in a hearing which saw the captain of the vessel dudnyk valentyn , of ukraine , repatriated .

documents.title: cumbrian climber sees high-altitude rescue
text: tim mosedale , from keswick , is currently leading an expedition climbing ama dablam in the himlayas .
it 's been an interesting day on the 22,349ft ( 6,812m ) mountain .
some incredibly brave and skilled helicopter flying today to rescue 2 climbers from the area of camp 3 on ama dablam - around 6,300m .
# amadablam

documents.title: boy tells rape trial that 'gang attack ' claim is a 'lie '
text: one of four boys accused of raping a 15-year-old girl in a workington field has told a carlisle crown court jury that her account of what happened is a lie .
all four of the boys , who are all under 16 , deny two charges of rape and a third of an additional sexual assault on the girl .
one of the boys told the jury the girl approached them , and asked two of them whether they wanted sex .
asked under cross-examination whether the four took turns to rape the girl , the boy said : `` it 's a lie . ''
the trial continues .

documents.title: dentists struggling to survive , says national association
text: one in five nhs dental practices in cumbria is struggling to survive , according to the british dental association .
it says morale is low , and some dentists are opting out of the nhs .
this means it 's difficult for patients to register with an nhs dentist , and some people are going without treatment , a situation highlighted today in appleby and sedbergh .
nhs england says access to its dentistry is improving and 22.2m adults were seen by an nhs dentist over the last two years .
practices are given a set amount of work to do , and can be penalised for doing either too much or too little , the bda 's vice-chairman eddie crouch says
one in five practices are struggling across cumbria are struggling and having money clawed back by the nhs , and that 's not being reinvested to deliver more services to patients . ''

documents.title: valley folk ensure they will remember thrimbling parrock
text: the old names of fields and other parts of the landscape in part of south cumbria are being recorded for future generations .
names such as thrimbling parrock and featherbed in the rusland valley will not be forgotten , thanks to a project funded by the national lottery .
sophia martin from the rusland horizons project says a lot of the information is coming from old maps .
also people 's memories , we 're asking people , what do you call this , what did your grandfather call it . ''
author: Neil Smith
South Cumbria journalist, BBC Cumbria

documents.title: rain warning posted for county
text: the met office says cumbria could see 2-4in ( 5-10cm ) of rain on wednesday , which could cause flooding .
the weather warning says the exact location of the heaviest rain is not certain at the moment .

documents.title: two cumbrian radio stations sold to media giant
text: two radio stations broadcasting to south cumbria have been sold by the county 's largest media company , cumbrian newspapers group .

the cn group , which owns the carlisle news and star and the north west evening mail in barrow , has sold the kendal-based lakeland radio , and the bay , which has studios in lancaster broadcasting to south cumbria and north lancashire .
the buyer , the media giant global , says the deal will let it take its radio brands - such as capital and heart - to more listeners .

documents.title: poppi inquest will hear from 39 witnesses
text: the inquest into the death of the toddler poppi worthington in 2012 will hear from 39 witnesses over up to three weeks , it 's been announced today .

poppi died at the age of 13 months in the furness general hospital from injuries that have never been satisfactorily explained , although in 2016 , a family court judge said he believed she was sexually assaulted before her death by her father paul worthington .
in july last year the crown prosecution service said it had insufficient evidence to charge mr worthington and he has always denied harming her in any way .
in other reports , the handling of the case by police , and the care of the family by social services , were both heavily criticised .
many of those involved , included pathologists and mr worthington , are listed to give evidence at hearings between 27 november and 15 december .
the coroner , david roberts , says he will issue his conclusions on 15 january .
author: Martin Lewes
Reporter

documents.title: gsk 's terry honoured for levelling 'gender balance '
text: the manager in charge of apprenticeships at the gsk plant in ulverston has been named man of the year by the organisation women in science and engineering .
terry sandham won the award , presented by the princess royal , after bringing the proportion of trainees at the pharmaceutical plant to 43 % .
the national average is 7.6 % .
terry said : i was very surprised because the people i was up against were a ceo and a vice president of two large organisations - while i work on the shop floor . ''
it makes good business sense to recruit the absolute best - and you ca n't do that if not enough women are applying for your jobs . ''

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : rain turning patchy
text: the rain will turn increasingly patchy through this afternoon , but the skies will remain overcast for most .
it will be milder than of late too .
temperatures will rise to about 12c ( 54f ) .
you can find the latest bbc weather forecast for where you live , here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: calls for hammond to back nuclear plant in budget
text: a professor from the university of cumbria has added his voice to calls for the government to show support for plans to build a nuclear power station near sellafield .
professor andy gale , the university 's director of industrial strategy , wants the chancellor to use this week 's budget to ensure work on the moorside project goes ahead .
nugen , the company behind the £ 10bn development is looking for a new investor after the nuclear arm of its parent company toshiba ran into financial problems .

documents.title: m-sport team flies on to podium to top winning season
text: m-sport driver ott tanak finished second in the rally of australia , meaning the cumbria-based team had a driver on the podium at every round of this season 's world rally championship .
it rounds off an extraordinary season of success for malcolm wilson 's family firm , based in cockermouth .
m-sport had already beaten the motorsports giants of the world to a clutch of championships by the end of last month .
author: BBC Cumbria Sport

documents.title: council calls on private landlords as more become homeless
text: private landlords in south lakeland are being offered financial incentives , as the council deals with rising numbers of homeless families .
south lakeland council is the first authority in cumbria to try this approach , as it has 3,200 households on its social housing waiting list , and only about 300 homes become available each year .

officials are also seeing an increase in families becoming homeless , from 66 in the whole of last year to 170 so far this year , and they are trying to encourage private landlords to accept tenants on benefits .

to try and increase the available property the council is offering grants , helping set up homes for rent and even in some cases paying contents insurance , minimising the risks and it says `` holding the hands '' of private landlords to encourage them to rent to benefits tenants .

documents.title: firefighters deal with shop blaze
text: three fire crews were called to a blaze in a shop in finkle street , in the centre of kendal , on sunday .
the fire on the ground floor , was believed to be caused by an electrical fault .
no one was hurt .

documents.title: barrow confidence grows as team quits relegation zone
text: barrow manager ady pennock says the bluebirds are growing in confidence after beating eastleigh away by 0-2 at the weekend .
pennock says the team now has to keep the winning form against gateshead tomorrow .
it 's a tough place to go over there , but we 're looking forward to the game . ''
author: BBC Cumbria Sport

documents.title: travel : crash slows frizington traffic
text: the a5086 is partly blocked by an accident on frizington road at park street , in frizington .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: art show reflects on storm desmond
text: art show reflects on storm desmond

documents.title: meet timmy , the tortoise who wants to be a little terror
text: a family in penrith say their pet tortoise has started getting territorial and is trying to scare them out of their garden .
timmy , who is 12 years old , joined john french and his family a couple of years ago and at first was docile , but they say he 's started biting , chasing and head-butting them .
he kept himself to himself , but this spring there was a complete turn-round , as soon as we opened the gate he 'd come charging out , and start biting at your feet . ''
it 's not just me , it 's any dogs , cats , birds that come into the garden , they get chased away , he 's just not happy if anyone goes anywhere near his area . ''
it is hoped that the hibernation period over winter will help timmy calm down a little .

documents.title: weather on the fell tops : gales and poor visibility
text: weather on the fell tops : gales and poor visibility

documents.title: dentists to stop seeing nhs patients at end of month
text: an increasing number of people in cumbria are going without dental treatment , because it 's too difficult to find an nhs dentist in the county .

the problem 's been highlighted in the east of the county , where dentists in appleby will stop providing nhs services at the end of the month , blaming increased costs and problems recruiting dentists .

one possible alternative , in sedbergh , says it 's fielding up to six calls a day from people in appleby , but ca n't treat more nhs patients because of the way the service is funded by nhs england .

we 've enquired a couple of times now , particularly in response to appleby , as to whether we can help in this by increasing our nhs commitment , and i 've been told that is something that is not happening at the moment . ''

documents.title: four rescued from foulney after tide comes in
text: four people , including two children , who were in danger of becoming stranded on foulney island off barrow , were rescued by a lifeboat crew yesterday morning .
foulney island is linked to the mainland by an uneven path , which disappears when the tide comes in .
the four , who tried to wade through the water , were cold and wet , but not injured , when rescued by the rnli crew .

documents.title: travel : resurfacing on a591 and work ongoing near keswick
text: in windermere , the a591 will close through the night from 18:30 to 01:00 from elleray road to cooks house corner , for resurfacing , from tonight until 18 december .
the a591 is also still closed north of keswick while a new water main is laid , between the a66 junction at crosthwaite roundabout and the b5291 castle inn junction .
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: cumbria 's weather : rain spreading east
text: it will be a rather cloudy morning with outbreaks of rain and drizzle spreading east , giving some heavy bursts at first .
it will be a milder day with temperatures reaching about 12c ( 54f ) .
you can find the bbc weather forecast for where you are , here .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning , and welcome to bbc cumbria live
text: we 'll be posting news , sport , weather and travel for cumbria through until about 18:00 .
if you 've got a story we should know about , or want to share a photo with the county , you can email them to us , send them using twitter where we 're @ twitterid or head to our facebook page .
author: Martin Lewes
Reporter
